availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Zachariah Wesley Bugg (Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney. Tennessee native. Son of Richard F. Bugg and Prudence M. Chappell Bugg. Married to Mary Alice Jackson Bugg. Father of Lucy P. Bugg and Richard Bugg. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Ballard County in 1860. Secretary of the Masonic Order of Kentucky at Blandville Lodge, No. 142, in 1860. Attorney in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 308B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 562.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, pp. 410A-410B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Ballard County, KY, June 1863, p. 2.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994027, Ballard County Births.
Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, Held in the City of Louisville, on Monday, the 16th Day of October, 1860 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges & Co., 1860), p. 124.
"Zachariah Wesley Bugg Sr. (1828-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #150339336, accessed September 15, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/150339336/zachariah-wesley-bugg.
